text: Sudan competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Open water swimming== Sudan qualified one male open water swimmer. ;Men {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%;" |- !Athlete !Event !Time !Rank |-align=center |align=left|Mohamed Ibrahim |align=left|Men's 5 km |colspan=2| |} ==Swimming== Sudan entered three swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Abobakr Abass |align=left|50 m freestyle |26.21 |112 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m breaststroke |1:09.34 |82 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=2|Izzeldin Ibrahim |align=left|50 m breaststroke |34.52 |68 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|50 m butterfly |28.62 |78 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ;Women {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font- size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Haneen Ibrahim |align=left|50 m freestyle |34.81 |96 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m freestyle |1:22.18 |93 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ==References== World Aquatics Championships Category:Nations at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships 2019
title: Sudan at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships
